meanings.definition: A person or entity that issues something again.
meanings.sent1: The reissuer of the magazine made sure to include updated information.
meanings.sent2: The reissuer of the certificate provided a duplicate copy for the student.
meanings.sent3: The reissuer of the tickets accidentally printed them with a funny typo.
meanings.sent4: As a reissuer of old records, he breathed new life into forgotten music.
meanings.sent5: The diligent reissuer meticulously checked each detail before releasing the document.

meanings.definition: To issue or publish something again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reissuer the article with additional research findings.
meanings.sent2: The company chose to reissuer the product due to popular demand.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally hit the reissuer button on the printer, causing a duplicate to be printed.
meanings.sent4: The author's decision to reissuer the book brought it back into the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The artist planned to reissuer the painting with a fresh perspective to attract new buyers.
